text: Such a weird, kind-of-boring, but fun-to-watch/play game. I think I picked it up for nothing, used, probably one of the last times I ever bought something physically from a local GameStop. I really like the music, and just running around. The Main Protagonist is completely idiotic and most characters are voiced competently but annoyingly.
author: Tommy Efreeti

text: I found this game pretty awful, and never really liked the soundtrack. This song is decent though :).
author: greenyxi

text: i'm from london! wish the violinists Â played this in the underground tube stations..
author: Warring God

text: That's so true. I bought this thinking 'Hmmm this looks fairly average' but I love me an RPG anyways. So I get home and and play it, and well, it was pretty average. Strange thing is I was finding myself sitting there for 6+ hours at a time playing the game. The battle system was fairly unique I thought, that coupled with the cheesy humor in the story and between characters was enough to keep me interested.
author: Xzaithyr Grymhart

text: Even with these flaws I ended up enjoying this game when I played through it. My favorite part was the beginning of the game because of Makoto.
author: PigeonSenpai

text: this game was overall mediocre, but not a bad game either. The worst part had to be the english voice acting. It was as if every line was accepted on the first take (frequent wrong inflections).

text:

Raigar: Cheap?
Atsuma: Yuki! Uh...Raigar, you're hearing things again.
Yuki: Yeah, clean out your ears!
This comes out of my head once I hear this!

text: I liked this rpg, was quite funny at some points. But I found this game to become drastically tough as you begin to near the end. You end up going through lots of training. My brother and his friend didn't think much of this and many other ppl don't think much about Enchanted Arms but I don't think it's awful, and it's quite addicting and I only ended up playing it by chance.

text: It's not bad at all, really.  It's not stellar, but it's very amusingly written - simultaneously using and breaking stereotypes.  Battle is fairly strategic and a little unque, but can be unforgivingly difficult against a couple of the bosses.  It's good overall, basically.
